decks.notes: This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield using fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Eye of Ugin. Utilizing disruption tools like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a consistent aggressive pressure. By leveraging the synergy between Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with its efficient threats and disruptive elements. Karakas provides additional utility against opposing Legendary creatures, adding further versatility to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to control the opponent's spells. It also includes various removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus to handle threats. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides additional value and card advantage. The deck aims to establish control of the game through counter magic and card manipulation, eventually winning the game through efficient removal and powerful card advantage engines.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through counterspells and card advantage, using cards like Counterbalance, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Sensei's Divining Top and Brainstorm provide card selection and manipulation, while Terminus and Swords to Plowshares handle threats on the battlefield. The deck also includes win conditions in Entreat the Angels and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, with Snapcaster Mage providing additional value by recasting key spells from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through patient gameplay and strategic decision-making.

The core idea of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Careful Study, then bring them back onto the battlefield using spells like Reanimate and Exhume. Cards like Griselbrand and Elesh Norn can quickly turn the tide in your favor, overwhelming your opponent with powerful reanimated creatures. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect your combo pieces. Show and Tell can be used to cheat a big threat into play ahead of schedule.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on fast, efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler, backed up by disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy and countermagic such as Daze and Force of Will. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game while disrupting their game plan with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Wasteland. The mana base is designed to support the three-color requirements of the deck while also providing access to powerful cards like True-Name Nemesis and Painful Truths.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently generate mana and use it to cast multiple spells in a single turn, ultimately leading to a win through the Storm mechanic. This is achieved through the use of fast mana sources like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal, along with rituals like Cabal Ritual and Dark Ritual. Cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm help filter through the deck to find combo pieces, while disruption cards like Cabal Therapy and Duress help protect the combo. The deck can quickly assemble the necessary cards to storm off and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main focus of this deck is to consistently apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with a mix of powerful spells and creatures. By utilizing efficient removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Toxic Deluge, along with disruptive creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Tarmogoyf, the deck aims to control the board state and outvalue the opponent. With access to powerful card advantage engines like Ancestral Vision and Shardless Agent, the deck can maintain a steady stream of threats and answers to stay ahead in the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors to ramp out powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly. It also utilizes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to apply pressure early with big threats like Reality Smasher and Endbringer, while also being able to protect itself with cards like Warping Wail and Dismember. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a stream of powerful threats and disrupt their game plan with counters and removal.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive Eldrazi creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, supported by mana acceleration from cards like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors. Additionally, cards like Warping Wail and Dismember provide additional interaction and removal options to control the board and clear the way for the Eldrazi creatures to deal massive damage.

The main concept of this Combo - Show and Tell Legacy deck is to quickly get out powerful creatures, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand, onto the battlefield through the use of cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. The deck also includes plenty of card draw and manipulation spells, like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Preordain, as well as protection spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to ensure that the combo can go off successfully. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and win the game quickly.

The key concept of this deck is to assemble a powerful board of Elves creatures through the use of efficient mana acceleration and card draw, with the ultimate goal of casting powerful spells like Natural Order to bring out a Craterhoof Behemoth for a game-winning attack. The deck combines the synergy of Elves and the versatility of Green Sun's Zenith to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a massive amount of creatures. The deck's mana base is optimized to support this strategy, with Gaea's Cradle serving as a linchpin for generating large amounts of mana.

The deck revolves around filling up the graveyard with Dredge cards such as Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, while also using cards like Faithless Looting and Cabal Therapy for disruption and card selection. The goal is to create a large graveyard presence, triggering cards like Bridge from Below and generating tokens like Ichorid and Narcomoeba. This allows the player to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and tokens, ultimately leading to a successful finisher like Dread Return. The deck also utilizes cards like Lion's Eye Diamond for fast mana acceleration and Cephalid Coliseum for card draw.

This deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through card advantage and disruption. By using cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Snapcaster Mage, and Counterbalance, the deck aims to control the board and answer threats efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares help deal with opposing creatures, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder allow for card selection and manipulation. The deck also utilizes the combo of Sensei's Divining Top and Counterbalance to control the top of the opponent's library, giving the player further advantage.

The deck aims to quickly put powerful creatures onto the battlefield through the combo of Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, or casting Emrakul or Griselbrand. The deck includes cantrips and counterspells to find and protect the combo pieces, as well as mana acceleration with Lotus Petal and lands like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors. The strategy revolves around cheating out big threats early in the game and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures that are difficult to deal with.

This deck focuses on using disruptive creatures and spells to slow down the opponent while also applying pressure through small creatures armed with powerful equipment. By utilizing efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and disruption through cards like Phyrexian Revoker, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while clocking them with creatures carrying powerful weapons like Sword of Fire and Ice. The deck also includes cards like Karakas and Aether Vial to further disrupt the opponent's strategy and gain an advantage in the game.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage provided by cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Sensei's Divining Top. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its win conditions in the form of Entreat the Angels and Council's Judgment. By using cards like Counterbalance and Brainstorm to manipulate the top of their library, the player can consistently answer threats and ensure their own powerful spells resolve.
